lines.content: > “It’s not knowing what to do; it’s doing what you know.” – Tony Robbins [(source)](https://dansilvestre.com/productivity-quotes/)
TooDoo is your very own task management chatbot. It is developed
Here are the steps to help you get started,
2. Double-click the .jar file to execute it **OR** If you are a seasoned programmer, type this into your terminal,
4. Let TooDoo handle the rest for you! :hatched_chick:
And the best part...it is **100% FREE** :)
- [x] Adding ToDos, Deadlines, and Events (with date and time support)
- [x] Find tasks that contain certain keywords

If you want to play around with the existing code base, feel free to fork and clone the [repo](https://github.com/ChekaLowQiJun/ip) to your local device and start right now! Let me get you started by showing you the ```main``` method:

* The main logic class for the TooDoo application.
* Handles user input processing, task list management, and interaction with storage and UI.
* Constructs the TooDoo chatbot by creating the Ui, Parser, Storage and TaskList object.
* It also checks if the storage .txt file exists.
* @param filePath The path to the storage .txt file.
* Processes a user input string and returns the response generated by the parser.
* @return The response string generated by TooDoo.
* Returns the welcome message for the user.
* Returns the exit message for the user.
* Saves the current task list to storage.
* Loads the task list from storage.
* @return A message indicating the result of the load operation.
return "Your task list from a previous run has been successfully loaded!";
return "It would seem that you have no existing task list! Starting a blank one for you now :)";
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to create an Event with a to earlier than the from.
super("Are you a time traveller...why is your too at a time before your from?");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to create a Deadline without specifying a deadline.
super("Oh dear...if your task has noo deadline, maybe it should be a toodoo.");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to create a Task without specifying a description.
super("Have you made a mistake? It would seem that your task's description is empty.");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to create an Event without specifying a from.
super("When does this event start? Maybe you should include it!");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to delete, mark or unmark a Task without specifying an index.
super("You must have forgotten too provide an integer representing the task's index -_-");
* Exception thrown when the regex provided is empty.
super("How am I going too find it if you don't give me any hints :\"(");
* Exception thrown when the regex provided is empty.
super("Can't be sorting an empty task list now, can we?");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to create an Event without specifying a to.
super("Goodness me! Does this event never end? Be sure too include the ending time.");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to delete, mark and unmark using an index that does not exist.
super("The task number that you specified does not exist :P");
* An Exception thrown if the Storage class attempts to load a .txt file that is not in the expected format.
super("Your .txt file seems too be using the wrong format! I will start a fresh one for you!");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to mark an already marked task.
super("The task you specified is already marked as done!");
* An Exception thrown when the user attempts to unmark an already unmarked task.
super("The task you specified is already marked as not done!");
* An Exception thrown when the Parser encounters an unknown Keyword.
super("Hmmmmm I doo not recognise this word: " + message);
* Represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to represent the speaker's face
* and a label containing text from the speaker.
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
* @param text The text input from the user.
* @param img An image representing the user.
* @return A DialogBox for the user's input.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
* @param text The text output from the TooDOo.
public static DialogBox getTooDooDialog(String text, Image img) {
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* The entry point of the TooDoo JavaFX application.
* This class sets up the primary stage and loads the main window.
* Starts the JavaFX application by loading the main window.
* @param stage The primary stage for this application.
* Initializes the main window by binding the scroll pane to the dialog container height.
* Injects the TooDoo instance into the main window.

* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* An enumeration of the Keywords the Parser expects from the user.
* The Parser is used by TooDoo to receive and process the input by the user.
* Returns a String representing the Keyword of the user's input.
* @param userInputStrings An array containing the words in the user's input.
* @return The keyword (first word) of the user's input.
* Processes the user's input and returns the response string.
* @param taskList A TaskList object used to manage TooDoo's task list.
* @return The response string generated by the command.
public String processUserInput(TaskList taskList, String userInput) {
assert taskList != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert userInput != null : "User input should not be null";
assert splitUserInput.length > 0 : "Input array should not be empty";
assert processedToDoString != null : "Processed ToDo string should not be null";
return "Please provide a valid integer for the task number :(";
* Processes the user's input when the todo Keyword is encountered and returns the todo's description.
* @param toDoStrings An array containing the words from the user's input when the todo Keyword is encountered.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If the todo's description is an empty string.
public String processToDoString(String... toDoStrings) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
* Processes the user's input when the deadline Keyword is encountered and returns
* @param deadlineStrings An array containing the words from the user's input
*     when the deadline Keyword is encountered.
* @return An array containing the deadlines's description and deadline.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If the deadline's description is an empty string.
* @throws EmptyDeadlineException If the deadline's deadline is an empty string.
public String[] processDeadlineString(String[] deadlineStrings) throws EmptyDescriptionException,
assert deadlineStrings != null : "Input array should not be null";
assert deadlineStrings.length > 1 : "Input should contain more than keyword";
* Processes the user's input when the event Keyword is encountered and
* returns the event's description, from and to.
* @param eventStrings An array containing the words from the user's input when the event Keyword is encountered.
* @return An array containing the event's description, from and to.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If the event's description is an empty string.
* @throws EmptyFromException If the event's from is an empty string.
* @throws EmptyToException If the event's to is an empty string.
* @throws DateTimeConflictException If the to is before the from.
public String[] processEventString(String[] eventStrings) throws EmptyDescriptionException,
assert eventStrings != null : "Input array should not be null";
assert eventStrings.length > 1 : "Input should contain more than keyword";
* Handles the user's input when the mark Keyword is encountered and returns the response string.
* @param splitUserInput An array containing the words in the user's input.
* @param taskList A TaskList object used to manage TooDoo's task list.
* @return Response string generated by marking the task.
* @throws EmptyIndexException If the index to be marked is not specified.
* @throws IndexDoesNotExistException If the index is out of bounds of the taskList.
* @throws TaskAlreadyMarkedException If the task specified is already done.
public String handleMark(String[] splitUserInput, TaskList taskList) throws EmptyIndexException,
* Handles the user's input when the unmark Keyword is encountered and returns the response string.
* @param splitUserInput An array containing the words in the user's input.
* @param taskList A TaskList object used to manage TooDoo's task list.
* @return Response string generated by unmarking the task.
* @throws EmptyIndexException If the index to be unmarked is not specified.
* @throws IndexDoesNotExistException If the index is out of bounds of the taskList.
* @throws TaskAlreadyUnmarkedException If the task specified is already marked as not done.
public String handleUnmark(String[] splitUserInput, TaskList taskList) throws EmptyIndexException,
* Handles the user's input when the delete Keyword is encountered and returns the response string.
* @param splitUserInput An array containing the words in the user's input.
* @param taskList A TaskList object used to manage TooDoo's task list.
* @return Response string generated by deleting the task.
* @throws EmptyIndexException If the index to be deleted is not specified.
* @throws IndexDoesNotExistException If the index is out of bounds of the taskList.
public String handleDelete(String[] splitUserInput, TaskList taskList) throws EmptyIndexException,
* Handles the user's input when the find Keyword is encountered and returns the response string.
* @param splitUserInput An array containing the words in the user's input.
* @param taskList A TaskList object used to manage TooDoo's task list.
* @return Response string generated by finding the task.
* @throws EmptyRegexException If the regex to find is not specified.
public String handleFind(String[] splitUserInput, TaskList taskList) throws EmptyRegexException {

* Marks a task in the task list at the specified index as done and prints the appropriate message.

* Unmarks a task in the task list at the specified index and prints the appropriate message.

* @throws TaskAlreadyUnmarkedException If the task specified is already marked as not done.
public String unmark(int index) throws IndexDoesNotExistException, TaskAlreadyUnmarkedException {
assert index < tasks.size() : "Index should be within bounds";

* Adds a ToDo to the task list.

* @throws DateTimeConflictException If the to is before the from.

* - Events and Deadlines come before ToDos

* - ToDos are sorted by description only
* @return A confirmation message indicating the tasks have been sorted.
// Events and Deadlines come before ToDos
boolean isTask1Timed = (task1 instanceof Event) || (task1 instanceof Deadline);
boolean isTask2Timed = (task2 instanceof Event) || (task2 instanceof Deadline);
// Both are timed tasks - compare by date

return "Your tasks have been sorted successfully!";
